Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: glazed black (mostly worn); exterior: black band (partly worn) covering rim and part of shoulder; reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: According to Schlotzhauer, the sherd belongs to a Typ 11.2.A South Ionian cup with everted rim. Very few Type 11 cups were found at Naukratis and Schlotzhauer suggests that these may have been made in specific workshops that rarely exported vases to Naukratis. The place of production of Type 11 South Ionian cups is determined as Miletus based on the results of NAA analysis carried out by Hans Mommsen, Bonn on another sherd (British Museum 1886,0401.570) from Naukratis and of same shape, decoration, and fabric. The number 285 is written in ink on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 285)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 667, no. 246)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 53, no. 372)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.154) (Phase 3)
